2.text: Hear ye diligently my word, And this is your consolation.

3.text: Bear with me, and I speak, And after my speaking—ye may deride.

4.text: I—to man is my complaint? and if so, wherefore May not my temper become short?

5.text: Turn unto me, and be astonished, And put hand to mouth.

6.text: Yea, if I have remembered, then I have been troubled. And my flesh hath taken fright.

7.text: Wherefore do the wicked live? They have become old, Yea, they have been mighty in wealth.

8.text: Their seed is established, Before their face with them, And their offspring before their eyes.

9.text: Their houses are peace without fear, Nor is a rod of God upon them.

10.text: His bullock hath eaten corn, and doth not loath. His cow bringeth forth safely, And doth not miscarry.

11.text: They send forth as a flock their sucklings, And their children skip,

12.text: They lift themselves up at timbrel and harp, And rejoice at the sound of an organ.

13.text: They wear out in good their days, And in a moment to Sheol go down.

14.text: And they say to God, ‘Turn aside from us, And the knowledge of Thy ways We have not desired.

15.text: What is the Mighty One that we serve Him? And what do we profit when we meet with Him?’

16.text: Lo, not in their hand is their good, (The counsel of the wicked Hath been far from me.)

17.text: How oft is the lamp of the wicked extinguished, And come on them doth their calamity? Pangs He apportioneth in His anger.

18.text: They are as straw before wind, And as chaff a hurricane hath stolen away,

19.text: God layeth up for his sons his sorrow, He giveth recompense unto him—and he knoweth.

20.text: His own eyes see his destruction, And of the wrath of the Mighty he drinketh.

21.text: For what is his delight in his house after him, And the number of his months cut off?

22.text: To God doth one teach knowledge, And He the high doth judge?

23.text: This one dieth in his perfect strength, Wholly at ease and quiet.

24.text: His breasts have been full of milk, And marrow his bones doth moisten.

25.text: And this one dieth with a bitter soul, And have not eaten with gladness.

26.text: Together—on the dust they lie down, And the worm doth cover them over.

27.text: Lo, I have known your thoughts, And the devices against me ye do wrongfully.

28.text: For ye say, ‘Where is the house of the noble? And where the tent—The tabernacles of the wicked?’

29.text: Have ye not asked those passing by the way? And their signs do ye not know?

30.text: That to a day of calamity is the wicked spared. To a day of wrath they are brought.

31.text: Who doth declare to his face his way? And for that which he hath done, Who doth give recompence to him?

32.text: And he—to the graves he is brought. And over the heap a watch is kept.

33.text: Sweet to him have been the clods of the valley, And after him every man he draweth, And before him there is no numbering.

34.text: And how do ye comfort me with vanity, And in your answers hath been left trespass?
